PTD Industrial Engineer

Job Description
Portland Technology Development Industrial Engineers are responsible developing industrial engineering methods for each technology in the areas of fab layout and capacity, implementing them locally, and then transferring them to the other sites (VF) around Intel. TD industrial engineers work with their process engineering counterparts and the equipment suppliers to create and validate capacity models for every equipment type. They use those models to in conjunction with the technologys semiconductor process flow to build a capacity Model of Record that is used to predict equipment quantities and timings to meet the technology ramps across the company. TD industrial engineers also work with process engineers and equipment suppliers to spatially optimize the configuration of first-of-a-kind equipment and use that information to create layout blocks and layout methodologies that are used at the TD site and across the VF. After developing the layout and capacity methods for the technology, TD industrial engineers transfer those methods to the other Intel sites by training the VF site industrial engineers and approving their sites layout. Locally, TD industrial engineers work with the construction team to ensure accurate implementation of the layout and with the operations teams on variety of fab efficiency improvement projects.

Qualifications
You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Qualifications:

You should possess a Master's degree in Industrial or Manufacturing Engineering along with the following:

6+ months in designing equipment layout and work flow
6+ months developing, validating and summarizing equipment performance data for capacity modeling and analysis
6+ months with documenting, training and reviewing/auditing the implementation of that material

***Must have legal right to work in the U.S. without sponsorship***

Other Locations

Posting Statement
Intel prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

Job Title: Industrial Engineer
Department: Legislative Branch
Agency: Government Publishing Office

Job Announcement Number: 16-1792085-TC

SALARY RANGE: $108,887.00 to $141,555.00 / Per Year

OPEN PERIOD: Monday 9/5/2016 to Monday 9/12/2016

SERIES & GRADE: PG-0801-14

POSITION INFORMATION: Full Time - Permanent

PROMOTION POTENTIAL: 14

DUTY LOCATIONS: 1 vacancy in the following location: Washington DC, DC

WHO MAY APPLY: US Citizens and Status Candidates

SECURITY CLEARANCE: Top Secret

SUPERVISORY STATUS: No

JOB SUMMARY:

Come be a part of one of the largest digital information facilities in the world!

Established by Congress in 1861, GPO is transforming itself as an agency and as a business. We provide other agencies with innovative services for the printing, publishing, storage, and distribution of digital content. The public will enjoy permanent access to digital government information, acquiring it quickly, easily, and with confidence in its authenticity. GPO employees are proud of their abilities and passionate about their craft. Whether your expertise is in putting ink on paper, commanding a digital output system, or engineering the delivery of information online, we'd like to talk to you.

This position is located in Security and Intelligent Documents, Office of the Managing Director, Office of the Operations Manager, Washington, DC.

Selectee will work Shift 1 and have a tour of duty of 8:00 am to 4:30 pm.

Security and Intelligent Documents (SID) is a secure manufacturing facility where as a recognized technical authority, the employee of the position provides expertise in the resolution of a broad range of critical project management and engineering challenges necessary to ensure successful manufacture of the U.S. Passport and other secure Federal credentials critical to the national interest. The impact of U.S. Passport manufacturing and other Secure Credential work affects GPO's ability to fulfill the needs of the Department of State, Department of Homeland Security and, in a broader sense, U.S. National Security.

DUTIES:

The employee serves as the Manufacturing Process Engineer with a background in process, mechanical, electrical, and/or software/industrial controls. The position requires a hands-on engineering background, engineering design/development experience, and a demonstrated ability to solve real problems within a high volume manufacturing environment. The employee is an expert advisor and consultant to officials and managers within as well as other engineers, and industry experts outside the GPO, to advise them on technical and project management issues. Specifically, the employee:

  • Will be assigned to "own" and resolve equipment and/or manufacturing process issues and generate a corrective action plan through coordination of pre- and post-operational analysis for U.S. e-Passport and Secure Credential Card Manufacturing. The employee is first and foremost a hands-on problem solver using strong systematic problem solving skills.
  • Serves as a technical leader of a multi-disciplined, multi-person project team to resolve production problems. The team may include resources from various departments such as production, quality, and product development. The employee may request support from internal departments and outside consultants as required.
  • May design mechanical modifications to Bindery and Press equipment to improve production capacity and throughput, and to decrease waste utilizing "best practice methodologies: such as Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE), Statistical Process Control (SPC) and other methodologies.
  • Verifies if new product designs developed by SID are producible or will recommend changes to make the product producible.
  • Creates, designs, builds, and installs a system to track and report factory metrics such as throughput, line balancing, equipment utilization and down time, and product spoilage. Report metrics on OEE. The employee may be asked to resolve problems adversely affecting these metrics by chartering and leading Kaizen events designed to foster employee engagement and sustain continuous improvement.
  • Charters and leads Six-Sigma/A3 projects designed to foster employee engagement and sustain continuous improvement.
  • Develops and executes test plans to verify solutions have solved defined problems.
  • Implements sensor systems (such as inspection technology), equipment or software improvements and verify results.
  • Develops standard operating procedures for new equipment for the various processes in manufacturing.
  • Participates in new product launches - creating Routers, Bills-of-Materials, Standard Work documents, and ISO procedures.
  • Develops proposals to cost justify programs to improve productivity, quality, and/or efficiency of the manufacturing operations.
  • Develops and tracks project plans including costs, milestones, schedules and resource requirements.
  • Makes presentations to peers and senior management regarding project results and performance.

Career Opportunities Sinclair Community College is currently seeking talented qualified candidates for the following career opportunity: 

Job Title: Industrial Engineering Technology Annually Contracted Position

Job Number: 03262

Department: Operations Technology

Job Category: Faculty

Job Type: ACF

Status: Regular

Job Open Date: 05/19/2017

Resume Review Date: 06/05/2017

Closing Date

Open Until Filled: Yes

Position Summary: Sinclair Community College is a comprehensive community college with an enrollment of over 23,000 students that offers career and transfer programs leading to an associate degree, certificate programs, and continuing education opportunities. The Science, Mathematics and Engineering Division at Sinclair is currently seeking candidates for an Annually Contracted Faculty opening in the Industrial Engineering Technology Department effective , August 16, 2017.

All positions are pending final budget approval for the 2017-2018 academic year.

Resume review will begin on: June 5, 2017.

Principal Accountabilities:

*Teach at least 30 credit hours per academic year

*Cooperate with full-time faculty, the department chairperson, and the division dean in implementing the instructional program

Requirements:

*Bachelor’s Degree in a field related to Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing, or Quality required

*Master’s preferred

*Expertise in Quality Engineering topics such as Metrology, Advanced Metrology (Coordinate Measuring Machines), Statistical Process Control, Calibration and American Society for Quality Certifications preferred

*Knowledge of Industrial Engineering topics such as Lean, Six-Sigma, Motion and Time Study and Engineering essential

*Teaching experience in IET or Quality classes is highly desirable

*ASQ certifications preferred

*Five years minimum industrial experience in IET or Quality environment essential

*Availability to teach on Dayton campus as well as off campus sites required

*A demonstrated commitment to improving student learning through innovative strategies shown to help students succeed at the course and program level, including ability to teach in a student-centered active learning model required

*Effective communication and interpersonal skills, and the capacity to work successfully in a culturally diverse college community required

INDUSTRIAL ENGINEER. Telescope Casual Furniture Inc is now hiring an Industrial Engineer. The ideal candidate would have familiarity with time studies, costing and excel in mathematics. Experience in the field of industrial engineering is preferred. Salary based on experience.

·         Review production schedules, engineering specifications, process flows and other information to understand methods and activities in manufacturing.

·         Figure out how to manufacture parts/products with maximum efficiency.

·         Develop management control systems to make financial planning and cost analysis more efficient.

·         Enact quality control procedures to resolve production problems and minimize cost.

·         Work with customers and management to develop standards for design and production.

·         Design control systems to coordinate activities and production planning to ensure that products meet quality standards.

·         Confer with Clients about product specifications, vendors about purchases, management personnel about manufacturing capabilities, and staff about the status of projects.

·         Some travel to observe processes and make assessments in various work settings.

·         Bridge between the technical and business side of the organization.

·         Supply chain management.

·         Assist with quoting.

·         Implement a LEAN Manufacturing program and audit/evaluate effectiveness.

·         Prove-Out system

·         Study product requirement s and design manufacturing and information systems to meet requirements.

·         Improve ways to distribute goods and services.

·         Determine most viable locations for equipment and processes for all locations, best layout of equipment and workspace to increase efficiencies/productivity.

·         Create sampling procedures and designs.

·         Evaluate accuracy of production and testing equipment.

·         Study and improve material flow and operational sequence.

·         Evaluate effects of product design changes.

·         Evaluates manufacturing processes by designing and conducting research programs; applying knowledge of product design, fabrication, assembly, tooling, and materials; conferring with equipment vendors; soliciting observations from operators.

·         Prepare product and process reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.

·         Completes design and development projects by training and guiding technicians.

·         Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.

·         Maintains product and company reputation by complying with government regulations.

Industrial Engineer

Summary: Responsible for evaluating existing processes & configuring mfg systems to reduce cost, improve sustainability & develop best practices w/i the production process.

  • Primary responsibilities
  • Evaluate processes in mfg systems while maintaining reliability and safety to improve production rates, efficiencies, yields, costs, and changeovers.
  • Assess process capabilities, prioritize process improvement opportunities, and innovates & implement process improvements on multiple & moderately complex processes.
  • Perform times studies, develops work standards, track & analyze data to track for improvement/monitoring.
  • Investigate occurrence of internal/external defects and recommend corrective actions.
  • Work with original equipment mfgs to develop cost-effective & working production processes.
  • Research & determine ROI of new mfg technology.
  • Improve mfg efficiency by analyzing & planning work-flow, space requirements & equipment layout
  • Lead & coach cross functional problem solving & process improvement teams.
  • Review production schedules, engineering specs, process flows & other info to understand methods & activities in mfg & services.
  • Enact quality control procedures to resolve production problems or minimize costs.
  • Design control systems to coordinate activities & production planning to ensure that products meet quality standards.
  • Resolve how to manufacture parts or products, or deliver services, w/ maximum efficiency.
  • Collaborate with all the depart managers & initiate, develop & complete cost saving projects.


Qualifications Required - We are seeking an engineer with a broad understanding of process improvement techniques & lean mfg principles & how those principles can be inc. into a rudimentary mfg process.

  • Master’s Degree in Industrial Engineering
  • Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certified
  • Minimum 2 yrs work exp in Mfg and PLC systems
  • Must have exp with VBA and SQL, ERP systems
  • Must have excellent Analytical / Problem Solving skills
  • Must be able to establish and promote a work environment that supports the Quality Policy and Quality System.
  • Experience w/implementation & auditing of ISO 9001
  • Results oriented, curious, & self-motivated w/the ability to effectively manage multiple tasks/projects.
  • In-depth exp with Lean Mfg methods & continuous improvement mindset.
  • Exp. using visual management systems.

ABOUT GARDNER ABRASIVES

Founded in 1905, Fives Landis Corp. (Gardner Abrasives) is a progressive abrasive wheel manufacturer located in South Beloit, IL. As a global manufacturing partner for key industries such as Automotive, Bearing, and Heavy Equipment, the Gardner Abrasives division remains a pioneer in innovation for custom-engineered abrasive & super abrasive grinding solutions.

ABOUT FIVES

Fives, an industrial engineering Group with more than 200 years of history, designs and supplies machines, process equipment and production lines for the world's largest industrial groups including the aluminium, steel, glass, automotive, aerospace, logistics, cement, and energy sectors. Headquartered in Paris (France), Fives has a network of over zoo operational units in nearly 30 countries worldwide, including 17 locations in the US. Five sustainably leads the future of manufacturing demonstrating each day that Industry Can Do It.

As a member of our new Industrial Engineering team, you will bring your hands-on IE experience and your strong understanding of Lean Manufacturing to find ways to eliminate wastefulness in the production of Penumbra's life-saving products. Working cross-functionally with R&D, Manufacturing, Quality Assurance, Facilities, Safety, and other groups, you will to drive continuous improvements in the effective use of workers, machines, materials, space and information.
 

The job

    • Coordinate and work on implementing best practices and ensuring that sites do not deviate from standard setup/line layout
    • Review production schedules, engineering specifications, process flows, work instructions, and other information to understand methods and activities in manufacturing and services.
    • Conduct time studies, identifying value/no-value added activities. Present findings and propose improvement plans.
    • Analyze processes to determine how to manufacture parts and products with maximum efficiency and quality. Standardizing and Implementing best practices across both sites.
    • Identify opportunities for improvement in the layout of equipment and work space.
    • Develop material flow through the implementation and disciplined use of Kanban and Supermarkets.
    • Work with manufacturing, quality and development engineers to identify equipment and process improvement opportunities.
    • Ensure a safe and healthy work environment. 

What you bring

    • The desire to work with a great team in an environment where your work makes a difference.
    • The creativity and ingenuity needed to design new production processes in many kinds of settings.
    • Critical-thinking skills, logic and reasoning to create new systems and to solve problems related to waste and inefficiency, and to come up with new approaches.
    • A hands-on approach to your work, with the ability to be open to new methods and technologies.
    • Knowledge and experience in Software systems including; Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, Power BI, MRP Systems, AutoCAD, SolidWorks, Microsoft Office, Advanced Excel Skills.
    • Outstanding oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills needed to explain concepts clearly and quickly.
    • A Bachelor's degree in Industrial or Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field.
    • Two to five plus years of Industrial Engineering experience, ideally in a medical device or similarly regulated organization.

What we offer

    • A collaborative teamwork environment where learning is constant and performance is rewarded.
    • The opportunity to be at the forefront of technology that is revolutionizing the treatment of some of the world's most devastating diseases.
    • A generous benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; a 401(k) match; and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
Penumbra, Inc., headquartered in Alameda, California, is a global healthcare company focused on innovative therapies.  Penumbra designs, develops, manufactures and markets novel products and has a broad portfolio that addresses challenging medical conditions in markets with significant unmet need.  Penumbra sells its products to hospitals and healthcare providers primarily through its direct sales organization in the United States, most of Europe, Canada and Australia, and through distributors in select international markets. The Penumbra logo is a trademark of Penumbra, Inc. 
 
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.
